meanings.definition: In a way that shows a disjunction or contrast between two or more elements.
meanings.sent1: She approached the problem disjunctively, considering each option separately.
meanings.sent2: The colors of the painting clashed disjunctively, creating a striking effect.
meanings.sent3: He packed his suitcase disjunctively, putting socks in the fridge and milk in his luggage.
meanings.sent4: The two political parties campaigned disjunctively, each promising opposite solutions to the same issue.
meanings.sent5: The music and lyrics of the song worked disjunctively, with the melody conveying happiness while the words spoke of sadness.

meanings.sent1: The twins disjunctively chose different paths in life, one becoming a doctor and the other an artist.
meanings.sent2: The tasks were completed disjunctively, with each team member working on their own part.
meanings.sent3: The ingredients in the recipe were added disjunctively, resulting in a cake that tasted like spaghetti.
meanings.sent4: The characters in the story acted disjunctively, each pursuing their own goals without regard for others.
meanings.sent5: The students answered the questions disjunctively, with each providing a unique perspective on the topic.
